Name: Kohl Container in Form of Palm-Shaped Column
Description: This glass container for kohl, an eye paint that was used to enhance beauty and protect the eyes, is shaped like a column that is designed to look like a palm. The capital, or top of the column, consists of nine wide palms. From the bottom to the middle, the container is painted with alternating yellow and white wavy designs. Below the capital, there are two lines painted yellow and another two painted white. The bases of the palms are painted yellow. Glass with such decorative patterns was not blown when it was made. It was molded around a clay core, which was then removed when the glass cooled. To obtain the garland and wavy decorations, the artisan applied little rods of yellow, white, and blue glass to the smooth, reheated surface of the container.
